intro: Yucca recurva, commonly known as the narrowleaf yucca, is a perennial plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its tall, unbranched stems and narrow, sword-shaped leaves that are often covered in a white powdery coating. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers in the spring, which are followed by blue-gray berries. Yucca recurva is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it well-suited for arid and semi-arid environments. Its striking appearance and low maintenance requirements make it a popular choice for xeriscaping and desert gardens.
